Package server

Class Server

java.lang.Object
jnet.JServer
server.Server
Direct Known Subclasses:
ChessServer
public abstract class Server extends jnet.JServer
Extendable server for a chess variant. This abstract class provides the framework for managing a chess game through a Board object. It also provides a command line interface for manipulating the board with the shell.

This class extends jnet.JServer. Children are expected to provide implementations for the client(Connected|Communicated|Disconnected) methods. Any child of this class created as a modification to this chess game should have the package server statement, allowing access to the protected getBoardInfo and setBoardInfo(engine.board.BoardInfo) methods of this class. These can be used for server-client communication.

The standard network protocol supported by this chess game is defined in the server.Communication class. (Note that this class assits with formatting and parsing commands, but does not guarantee data integrity; this is the responsibility of any child of this server class or the graphical client view classes).

IMPORTANT NOTE: as defined in the documentation for Board.makeMove(Move), it is the responsibility of the server to confirm the legality of moves before making them on the board. Nothing can be guaranteed if a valid, but illegal, move is played on the board. Implementations of the Server class are responsible for this because of the possibility for modified move generators (in other words, the MoveGenerator class is not always used for custom variants).

A basic implementation of checking for legal moves is as follows: 

 
 List<Move> legalMoves = MyMoveGenerator.generateLegalMoves(super.getBoardInfo());
 if (!legalMoves.contains(move))
     return;

  • Constructor Details

    • Server

      public Server(String ip, int port) throws IOException
      Constructs a new Server object. This constructor initializes the jnet.JServer super-class, the Board object managed by this class (which can be accessed through the board info getter and setter), and starts the cli.
      Parameters:
      ip - the IP address to bind the server to.
      port - the port to bind the server to.
      Throws:
      IOException - if a network error occurs during server startup.

  • Method Details

    • getBoard

      protected Board getBoard()
      Returns the board managed by this server. This method is intended to be used in order to make moves on the board from a child of this server class.
      Returns:
      the board managed by this server.

    • getBoardInfo

      protected BoardInfo getBoardInfo()
      Returns the board information managed by this server. This information may only be accessed by the ServerCLI or child classes of this server.
      Returns:
      the board information managed by this server.

    • setBoardInfo

      protected void setBoardInfo(BoardInfo boardInfo)
      Sets the board information managed by this server. The board can only be modified by the ServerCLI or children of this server.
      Parameters:
      boardInfo - the board information to set.

    • sendBoard

      public void sendBoard()
      Sends a board state command to all connected clients. This operation is ignored if this server's board information is null.

    • sendBoard

      public void sendBoard(jnet.JClientSocket clientSocket)
      Sends a board state command to the specified client. This operation is ignored if the argument client socket is null or this server's board information is null.
      Parameters:
      clientSocket - the client to send the state to.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Advises the user to host a server through the GUI client.
      Parameters:
      args - command line arguments.
